newsitem.title: CANADA: Canada's Martin plans to cut unemployment premiums.
newsitem.headline: Canada's Martin plans to cut unemployment premiums.

text.p: Canada's Finance Minister Paul Martin repeated on Tuesday he intends to cut unemployment insurance premiums, but in a "responsible manner."
"We are going to cut them in a responsible manner," Martin told reporters after a parliamentary question period.
Earlier on Tuesday he said he would look into a senior government bureaucrat's recommendation to let the surplus in the unemployment insurance fund rise well above its current level.

Michel Bedard, chief actuary for the Human Resources Department, which runs the unemployment insurance system, wrote to Martin recommending to let the surplus of the system run up to C$10 billion or C$15 billion.
"The Human Resource actuary's report is a professional report, done by an expert. I will look into it and we will discuss it," Martin said.
